title.narrative: Improving the education system towards sustainable delivery of equitable, quality and protective education services for most vulnerable learners/children in Baidoa IDP settlements.

description.narrative: The project targets most vulnerable IDP learners/children in Baidoa districts who have been worst affected by the crisis in Southwest State. HNO 2018 identifies Baidoa to be hosting the largest IDPs in Somalia followed by Mogadishu. This is relatively due to its proximity to conflict-prone areas and also because of the relative calmness/stability recently witnessed in the region. READO in response to emergency-affected learners in the larger Somalia has proposed this project to mainly keep 3396 learners (2200 from IDP settlements) and 59 teachers (9 locations within Baidoa IDP settlements: Al-absar primary school, Onka Made IDP school, Bay and Bakool IDP school, Madhayto IDP school, -Misnaqaata IDP school, Wariri IDP, Bakare yarey IDP, Hanaano 2 IDP and Howlwadag School - these locations have no ongoing projects) and 28 CECs (drawn from both IDP and host community) at school with a child protection lenses in solving the case of high school dropout rate following the 2017 drought and myriads of child protection issues that accompanied the crisis including child labour, early marriages, abuse and deprivation of rights. Flood Response Plan by OCHA, May 2018 has indicated that most schools in flood-prone areas have been affected and destroyed thus the schools will need reconstruction and rehabilitation. Through the provision of water, food, training on child protection issues including PSS, DRR, Referral pathways and supply of teaching and learning materials, READO will manage to address Education and Protection concerns brought about by the drought by using the existing schools as the entry point to address child protection concerns. This is hoped to reach some 3492 boys, girls, men and women through community awareness, child/family tracing, unification and referral outreach programming that will target the IDP camps and settlements where the learners are coming from and those in close proximity to the schools in a period of 12 months with the assumption that the region will remain stable with no further calamities
